<size=45>Chapter 4 - Surcouf in the Noon</size>

scripts.say: Port - Cafeteria
Commander, I want some of those meatballs, octopus weiners, that thing... those, and that! C'mon, gimme!
Hey! I specifically chose different sides so I could trade with you, you know!
I'm not just gonna take without giving! Here, have this, some of this... this too, and... I don't like giving this one up, but here!
Heheh, isn't it great to have such a generous secretary?
Ah, enjoying lunch together with the Commander again? Aren't you a lovely couple.
G'day, Dunkerque! Wait, don't you know? I'm the Commander's secretary, so there's nothing strange about us having lunch together!
Aha, I suppose that's true. By the way, I made a few confections today. Do visit me later if you'd like some.
Really?! Heck yeah~ Hey, Commander, once we're done working, let's drop by Dunkerque's place for some tasty sweets!
Now then, I'll be on my way before I become a nuisance.
Au revoir!
Man, Dunkerque's such a nice girl, don't you think?
There's this other girl, Jean Bart, from the same faction. But in stark contrast to the sweet and caring Dunkerque, Jean Bart is kind of cold and mean...

Which reminds me of some fun trivia! Commander, did you know that both Jean Bart and I got our names from famous pirates? Though I'm not sure if her namesake was a pirate or technically some other thing...
Anyhow, I guess she's got some appeal. Piratey appeal. I wouldn't say I'm like that, though.
Eat a lot, sleep a lot, fight a lot! And everything else is your responsibility~ That's the life I wanna live~
I don't blame people for getting the impression that Surcouf is a lazy girl. But there's more to her than that...
When it comes to combat and mission performance, I've heard nothing but good things about her.
Still, sometimes I think about how cool she can be. I'm sure lots of people do.
She's all like "keep your damn distance!" and stuff. Hey, you try it, Commander! I wanna hear you say it!
... Let's just focus on our lunch.
